intro: Marenteria, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The leaves are typically palmately divided, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. Marenteria species are herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, well-drained soils. They are often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies.
